data.name: Skreid B2B Trip A
data.body: Raised in Grand Forks, BC. DJ/Producer Skreid is known in his area for his heavy basslines and flowing style that will get the crowd bouncin'. Started at The Woods Nightclub with help and support from Pagoda mastermind DJ Soup, he started his climb into the music industry. Skreid has a diverse range and taste of Dubstep/DNB/House and everything in between and out of the box to grace those earholes, you wont be disappointed!

data.name: Dr. Fresch B2B Destructo
data.body:
Gary Richards, known by his stage name Destructo, is an American music executive, concert promoter, and DJ. As of September 1, 2017, he is the President of LiveStyle, North America. Prior to joining LiveStyle, he was the founder and CEO of HARD Events, a concert brand that has put on popular music festivals since 2007, which was acquired in 2012 by Live Nation Entertainment. He has performed professionally as a DJ under the name Destructo for over 20 years, having toured worldwide. He is credited with being a leader in the electronic music genre in North America and with helping to bring artists like Deadmau5 and Justice into the mainstream. Richards is included on Rolling Stone's "50 Most Important People in EDM" list, Billboard's "EDM Power Players" lists from 2014–2017, and inthemix's list of the "50 Most Powerful People in EDM". As Destructo, he has released four EP's titled Technology, Higher, West Coast, and RENEGADE respectively.

In 2013 after winning Insomniac’s Discovery Project Contest, Tony Fresch launched the Dr. Fresch project. His debut self-titled EP and innovative hip-hop/rap remixes quickly exploded in the blogosphere. Dr. Fresch’s music weaves together elements of house, hip-hop/rap, and midtempo to create a unique, forward-thinking sound. Over the summer of 2015, Dr. Fresch launched his semi-monthly mix series “House Call” which has since garnered tens of millions of plays. The Dr. Fresch brand has continued to grow with the launch of his record label “House Call Records.” Dr. Fresch plays a prominent role on the festival circuit with plays at likes EDC Las Vegas, Paradiso, Moonrise, Electric Forest, CRSSD, Splash House, Osheaga, Shambhala and more.

data.name: Pav4n & Strategy
data.body:
PAV4N has a slew of singles dropping over the year with the likes of Raga, Wraz, Strategy, Killa P, Hypho, Mythm, Noer the Boy, Badklaat, Funtcase, Harry Shotta, benny L, Document One, Airglow,12th Planet, Zurglin, Illaman, Sepia & Many More.

PAV4N is the founding member of the critically acclaimed electronic rap group Foreign Beggars and one of the most prolific MC’s of Indian origin of all time & the first rapper of Indian descent to have a top 10 single in the UK Charts.

PAV4N has worked plethora of incredible producers including Skrillex, Noisia, Steve Aoki, Knife Party, Dj Vadim, Sez on the Beat, Flux Pavilion, Ganja White Knight, Alix Perez, Visages, Truth, Tommy lee of Motley Cru and has 60 + releases since the launch of his solo project in 2020.

With 7 Studio albums under his belt and 17 years of live show experience, PAV4N is known for his explosive, high energy performances with genre spanning hip hop, grime, dubstep & Drum and bass.

Since 2021 PAV4N has performed at Glastonbury Festival. Boomtown, Shambhala, Nozstock, Locus, NH7 Festival, Breezer Shuffle & has just come off the back of extensive India, UK & North American Tours.

In 2020, PAV4N founded 4NC¥ & //DarkMode , 2 prolific record labels with a focus on elevating South East Asian talent. 4NC¥ is a global platform and network for underground musicians and visual artists dedicated to breaking records from new talent and seasoned artists alike. Its unique business model puts forth releases that feature both aspiring and well-known visual artists to create an artistic experience and identity for each piece that goes beyond audio and blends different disciplines of artistry. The label’s releases encompass genres such as lo-fi, hip hop, trap, grime, 160, jungle/drum & bass, selective house, techno, and future soul/r&b – paying homage to Pavan’s hip hop and electronic roots. 4NC¥ currently platforms over 100 artists across the globe today and works alongside the most influential and underground magazines, culturemakers, music promoters, and festivals of our time.

Since the beginning of his career, PAV4N has worked with and released music under the world’s most leading and innovative music labels, including Sony Music, Warner Music, Universal Music Group, Ministry of Sound, Owsla, Mau5trap, 1985 Music, Never Say Die, Disciple Records, Dim Mak, Circus Recordings, Chinese Man Recordings, Quality Goods, Ram Records, and Vision Recordings. He has also worked on various musical ventures in Hollywood and the Gaming industries, including musical soundtracks for Fast & Furious 7, Die Hard III, CSI Los Angeles, Fifa 13, Fifa 2022 Fifa 2023 & FFifa 2024 Need for Speed, Eastenders, and Skins.

Recent highlights include coverage from Rolling Stone India, The Times of India, The New Indian Express, UKF, Outlook India, I Am Hip Hop, Lifestyle Asia, Lifted Asia, India Today, iamCrü, The Telegraph, The Source, Dubai Hot 40 music charts, The Indian Music Diaries, Homegrown Co India, Khaleej Times, Red Bull, Himmat Media, Rosecrans Ave, FUXWITHIT, Mister Mime World, Juice, The 3000 Network, Desi Hip Hop, WORDPLAY.

PAV4N has supported the Prodigy on their ‘Run With The Wolves’ UK tour and countless other artists including Amy Winehouse, Snoop Dogg, Sub Focus, Deadmau5, Faith No More, The Chemical Brothers & Many More.

PAV4N has released on Mau5trap, Ministry of Sound, Ram Records, Critical Recordings, Owsla, Sony Music, Warner Music, Blackout Recordings, Never Say Die Records, Vision Recordings, Monstercat, Dim Mak, Black Butter records to name a few.

data.name: Subvert w/ Armanni Reign
data.body: Armanni Reign: From the lunchroom tables to street corner cyphas... from battle rap competitions to hosting some of the biggest festivals in the world... the MC Armanni Reign has become one of the most versatile multi-genre MC's on the planet. Since 2004, MC Armanni Reign has become a go to recording voice regardless of genre from hosting stages with some of the world's most elite DJ's and other music acts to music recordings creating performance memories and chart topping smashers like Ray Volpe's "Purpose", Spag Heddy's "Strayed UP", Barely Alive's "Hackers", Riot's "LSAR", Zomboy's "Outbreak", Virtual Riot's "Running from the Cops" to Hybrid Trap like Stereolize's "Paper Chaser", A Boy and a Girl's "Stampede", Mark Instinct's "The Show", "Suicide Pill", and "Pour It Out". From STS9's "Balancing" to 12th Planet and The Trickaz's floor killer "Bless That" or smoother vibes like AC Slater x TS7's "Step Back", Kastle's "Timeless" to Mayhem and Logam's DnB roller "We Will", he has proven versatility is an asset. Armanni Reign has DB releases currently on RAM, ProgRAM, Gasm, Freak, Intasound, Westbay Music Group, TekDbz accompanied by Dubstep/EDM Trap releases on Monstercat, Disciple, Circus, Play Me, Never Say Die, Rotton, Uplink Audio, Buygore and Firepower as well as Hip Hop projects on SKRONG and Division. His affinity for movies and video games has translated over to the sync world. His music can be heard on AAA television and internet advertising campaigns such as "Fast and Furious 9", Square Enix's "Just Cause 4", Gearbox's "Borderlands 3", Ubisoft's "Ghost Recon: Breakpoint" and more as a solo artist or collaborative act known as Artizan with a music catalog that stretches across everything from Netflix to MTV.

data.name: Georgie Riot w/ Armanni Reign
data.body:
Georgie Riot: DJ, producer and curator of Drum & Bass record label Riot Records; Georgie broke into the scene in 2021 and has been causing waves across the globe ever since. Georgie is known for her creative double drops, fast pace mixing and energetic live performances. Georgie has been producing all kinds of drum & bass since 2021; from melodic, uplifting dancefloor, to high impact energetic jump-up. She is the perfect example of what hard work and dedication can do for an artist who is determined. She has honed her skills and built a strong brand in a short space of time and has gained the attention of fans and other artists across the globe.​

​A dedicated DJ who ditched her career as a professional model and agent for a life in the music industry, this is everything she’s pursued since her first drum & bass rave: from handing out flyers and sneaking into venues underage, to playing drums in a band and studying music technology.
​The 27 year old began djing in 2020 and started her journey with production in 2021.

Georgie is breaking boundaries in production following on from her debut single ""Take Over"" which was released on world renowned label UKF just 6 months after she began learning to produce. It gained over 100,000 streams in under two weeks, was featured across multiple Spotify and Apple editorial playlists, and was featured heavily on BBC Radio 1.

Georgie's debut EP ""Take Over"", named after her leading single was released with UKF on August 3rd 2022. In December 2022 Georgie remixed Oliver Tree's chart-topping ""Miss You"", which was released on Atlantic Records (US). The track has over 2 million streams on Spotify alone.

Since then she has released music on WARNER, DNB ALLSTARS, VIPER, DEVICE and RIOT RECORDS. In December 2022 Georgie completed her first tour across New Zealand and Australia; performing at New Zealand's biggest and most prestigious festivals including Rhythm & Vines, Golden Lights and Golden Nights, to name a few. After the huge success of her first tour, in June 2023 Georgie returned for a second tour of Australia, this time for a winter club show run co-headlined with Dr Fresh (USA), as well as her own headline shows in New Zealand. Georgie has been selling out headline shows in the UK, Austria, Spain, amongst other countries in Europe. She has had ample bookings for 2023, playing across the biggest festivals in Europe including Let It Roll (CZ), Rampage (BE), Dreamland (DE), Leeds Festival (UK), Frequency Festival (AT), Nass Festival (UK), Tokyo World (UK), Blacklist Festival (DE), and many more. Summer 2023 has been huge for Georgie so far. In September 2022 Georgie launched her own record label RIOT RECORDS. She has been releasing her own music as well as music from the likes of Captain Bass, Klay, Gouki, to name a few. Riot Records was named as Beatport’s “Label Of The Month” at the beginning of 2023. Georgie has released guest mixes with the likes of BBC Radio 1, KISS, RINSE, SWU and New Zealand's George FM. In May 2023, Georgie began hosting a monthly radio show called “Causing A Riot”. The show airs every third Saturday of the month on KOOL FM, hosted by RINSE FM. 2024 is set to be an exciting year for Georgie, with plans to return to New Zealand and Australia for a third tour, as well as much more music on the way. Georgie will continue to grow as an artist and reach new heights.​ As a woman who has always always been involved in a male dominated industry, Georgie believes it is time for females to be supported and represented within the music industry to the same extent men are. She is hoping to inspire other women to step forward and see music as an option.

Armanni Reign: From the lunchroom tables to street corner cyphas... from battle rap competitions to hosting some of the biggest festivals in the world... the MC Armanni Reign has become one of the most versatile multi-genre MC's on the planet. Since 2004, MC Armanni Reign has become a go to recording voice regardless of genre from hosting stages with some of the world's most elite DJ's and other music acts to music recordings creating performance memories and chart topping
smashers like Ray Volpe's "Purpose", Spag Heddy's "Strayed UP", Barely Alive's "Hackers", Riot's "LSAR", Zomboy's "Outbreak", Virtual Riot's "Running from the Cops" to Hybrid Trap like Stereolize's "Paper Chaser", A Boy and a Girl's "Stampede", Mark Instinct's "The Show", "Suicide Pill", and "Pour It Out". From STS9's "Balancing" to 12th Planet and The Trickaz's floor killer "Bless That" or smoother vibes like AC Slater x TS7's "Step Back", Kastle's "Timeless" to Mayhem and Logam's DnB roller "We Will", he has proven versatility is an asset. Armanni Reign has DB releases currently on RAM, ProgRAM, Gasm, Freak, Intasound, Westbay Music Group, TekDbz accompanied by Dubstep/EDM Trap releases on Monstercat, Disciple, Circus, Play Me, Never Say Die, Rotton, Uplink Audio, Buygore and Firepower as well as Hip Hop projects on SKRONG and Division. His affinity for movies and video games has translated over to the sync world. His music can be heard on AAA television and internet advertising campaigns such as "Fast and Furious 9", Square Enix's "Just Cause 4", Gearbox's "Borderlands 3", Ubisoft's "Ghost Recon: Breakpoint" and more as a solo artist or collaborative act known as Artizan with a music catalog that stretches across everything from Netflix to MTV.

data.name: A.M.C w/ Armanni Reign
data.body:
A.M.C: Entertainer, technical craftsman, lifelong student of drum & bass, meticulous grafter; A.M.C represents and embodies just what it takes to operate in the DJ premiership in the 2020s.

Three-times Best DJ winner in the Drum&BassArena Awards 2019-2021, renowned for his razor-sharp, four-deck performances and physical, impassioned mixing style; Alex Mark Calvert has invested every living, breathing moment of his focus, attention and appetite into drum & bass since his teens to become one of the most influential and highly respected artists in his field.

Part of the last generation of DJs to graduate from original dubplate culture, and famed for his ability to tell sonic stories and connect myriad dots across the last 30 years of UK jungle and drum & bass, Alex’s fusion of foundational roots and futuristic sounds resonates across the drum & bass movement’s many generations and territories. A DJ who can sell-out a North American tour just as quickly as he can sell-out London venues like Fabric room one and E1, or full tours of New Zealand and Australia, his ‘people’s champion’ reputation transcends boundaries and borders, leading to a phenomenal international popularity across the global D&B scene.

This reputation is also reflected in his streaming statistics. With both of his albums – ‘Energy’ (2019) and ‘Void’ (2021) – boasting millions of streams on Spotify, and releases on distinguished labels such as Ram Records, Monstercat, UKF, Drum&BassArena, Charge, Dim Mak, Blackout, Eatbrain and Low Down Deep (to name a few) Alex has translated his unique DJ vocabulary in the studio to become just as respected as a producer. Still seeing himself as a DJ first and foremost, every A.M.C studio creation is made strictly with the dancefloor in mind. His natural habitat, it’s the place where Alex feels most at home… As an entertainer, a craftsman, a student, a grafter and a man who will forever invest every living, breathing moment into this music.

Armanni Reign: From the lunchroom tables to street corner cyphas... from battle rap competitions to hosting some of the biggest festivals in the world... the MC Armanni Reign has
become one of the most versatile multi-genre MC's on the planet. Since 2004, MC Armanni Reign has become a go to recording voice regardless of genre from hosting stages with some of the world's most elite DJ's and other music acts to music recordings creating performance memories and chart topping smashers like Ray Volpe's "Purpose", Spag Heddy's "Strayed UP", Barely Alive's "Hackers", Riot's "LSAR", Zomboy's "Outbreak", Virtual Riot's "Running from the Cops" to Hybrid Trap like Stereolize's "Paper Chaser", A Boy and a Girl's "Stampede", Mark Instinct's "The Show", "Suicide Pill", and "Pour It Out". From STS9's "Balancing" to 12th Planet and The Trickaz's floor killer "Bless That" or smoother vibes like AC Slater x TS7's "Step Back", Kastle's "Timeless" to Mayhem
and Logam's DnB roller "We Will", he has proven versatility is an asset. Armanni Reign has DB releases currently on RAM, ProgRAM, Gasm, Freak, Intasound, Westbay Music Group, TekDbz accompanied by Dubstep/EDM Trap releases on Monstercat, Disciple, Circus, Play Me, Never Say Die, Rotton, Uplink Audio, Buygore and Firepower as well as Hip Hop projects on SKRONG and
Division. His affinity for movies and video games has translated over to the sync world. His
music can be heard on AAA television and internet advertising campaigns such as "Fast and Furious 9", Square Enix's "Just Cause 4", Gearbox's "Borderlands 3", Ubisoft's "Ghost Recon: Breakpoint" and more as a solo artist or collaborative act known as Artizan with a music catalog that stretches across everything from Netflix to MTV.

Since 2004, MC Armanni Reign has become a go to recording voice regardless of genre from hosting stages with some of the world's most elite DJ's and other music acts to music recordings creating performance memories and chart topping smashers like Ray Volpe's "Purpose", Spag Heddy's "Strayed UP", Barely Alive's "Hackers", Riot's "LSAR", Zomboy's "Outbreak", Virtual Riot's "Running from the Cops" to Hybrid Trap like Stereolize's "Paper Chaser", A Boy and a Girl's "Stampede", Mark Instinct's "The Show", "Suicide Pill", and "Pour It Out". From STS9's "Balancing" to 12th Planet and The Trickaz's floor killer "Bless That" or smoother vibes like AC Slater x TS7's "Step Back", Kastle's "Timeless" to Mayhem
and Logam's DnB roller "We Will", he has proven versatility is an asset. Armanni Reign has DB releases currently on RAM, ProgRAM, Gasm, Freak, Intasound, Westbay Music Group, TekDbz accompanied by Dubstep/EDM Trap releases on Monstercat, Disciple, Circus, Play Me, Never Say Die, Rotton, Uplink Audio, Buygore and Firepower as well as Hip Hop projects on SKRONG and
Division. His affinity for movies and video games has translated over to the sync world. His
music can be heard on AAA television and internet advertising campaigns such as "Fast and Furious 9", Square Enix's "Just Cause 4", Gearbox's "Borderlands 3", Ubisoft's "Ghost Recon: Breakpoint" and more as a solo artist or collaborative act known as Artizan with a music catalog that stretches across everything from Netflix to MTV.

data.name: Village Rinse Out Hosted by John Rolodex
data.body:
John Rolodex is a trailblazing DnB artist from Edmonton, Canada. Releasing music on acclaimed labels for over 20 years, he's considered one of the seminal international artists in North America. His early releases on Ray Keith's Dread Recordings led to global recognition of his signature, heavyweight sound and support from significant figures in the genre, including numerous spins by the venerable John Peel (OBE) on his iconic BBC Radio 1 show.

Early on, John Rolodex captured the attention of Goldie, leading to releases on his legendary Metalheadz imprint and an ongoing affiliation with the label that continues today.

In 2010, John founded his own imprint, Machinist Music, a label focusing on raw, undiluted sounds within DnB. Early Machinist releases include some of the first from Rene LaVice, Trex, and Acid Lab. In the subsequent decade and a half, Machinist has released music from dozens of established and developing artists around the globe. Machinist Music is now operated alongside Dioptrics (USA).

Rolodex has headlined events in dozens of cities across Europe and North America, from Oslo to Budapest and New York to Vancouver. His ongoing relationship with Bassdrive.com has led to tens of thousands of new fans across the globe. His recent guest mix for Re.set Radio in Colombia reported an audience exceeding one million.

Decades into his journey in music, Rolodex has directed music videos, created multimedia art, and completed scoring work for film and television. He enjoys combining sound and visuals and regularly does so in various capacities for his releases on Metalheadz and other artists on various labels.

data.name: TF Marz B2B parkbreezy
data.body:
TF Marz: TF Marz, a luminary and founding member of the Denver-based all:Lo Collective, stands at the intersection of Hip Hop and R&B sensibilities, weaving those sensibilities seamlessly with the lush and deep sounds of bass music. Imbued with the influence of Northwest’s rich bass music
culture, TF’s cutting-edge selections and moody productions are like a breath of fresh air
for every dance floor he rocks.

Parker Williams, also known as parkbreezy, is a talented instrumentalist, producer, and artist who creates soulful and emotive beats. His music is a fusion of various genres, including Hip Hop, R&B, Soul, Jazz, and Electronic Music. Parker's style incorporates resampling, syncopated percussion, propulsive bass lines, and affectional melodies. He continues to progress and shape his style, incorporating new knowledge and past inspirations into his musical compositions.

data.name: EVeryman & JoaqoPelli
data.body:
Evan Shafran, A.K.A. EVeryman, is a multi-talented artist who has made a name for himself in the worlds of comedy, acting, and music. His unique blend of talents has made him a versatile performer, allowing him to entertain audiences around the world in a variety of mediums.
EVeryman delivers a fluid flow, with conscious optimistic lyricism. His high energy beats convey influences from old school hip hop and reggae which brings the crowd to life up on their feet. As a DJ, Everyman drops anything from breaks, glitch hop, sexy house, to drum and bass. Everyman is one half of 'Little Giants', a hip hop group formed with the late great, LA DJ/ Producer Pumpkin aka Nick Alvarado.

As a comedian, Shafran has been praised for his ability to bring humor to complex social issues. His stand-up sets are characterized by their insightful and thought-provoking commentary, often touching on topics such as politics, race, and inequality. In addition to his work as a comedian, Shafran has also appeared in a number of films and television shows.

Through his work in comedy, acting, and music, Shafran has established himself as a unique and versatile performer. He has used his platform to speak out about important social and environmental issues, and his dedication to promoting diversity and representation in media has made him a respected figure in the entertainment industry.

Patience Is The Science Of Peace!!!

data.name: Mikey Lion B2B DJ SOUP
data.body:
Mikey Lion: I started out as a Hip-Hop head, bumping Wu-Tang records in my bedroom at age 13. My love affair with House music began at Coachella 2006, when a little band known as Daft Punk flipped my world upside down and set me on the path I’ve been on ever since.

After some experimentation in throwing parties and gigging, my life purpose became crystallized at 24 years old during a life-changing psychedelic experience. Spirit guides manifested in the trees, revealing that the way of the universe is love and that my life's purpose is to spread it far and wide.

A few months later in the fall of 2012, I teamed up with partners Marbs, Lee Reynolds, and my younger brother Porky to throw the very first Desert Hearts party. The intention was to spread as much love and positive energy as possible while soundtracked to the sound of nonstop House and Techno in the middle of the Mojave Desert. This message of love must have resonated with all 200 attendees at the time, because nine years later our Desert Hearts Festival is now a 5,000 - person event that I'd put up against any other party in the world as the best on Earth.

Along the way I launched Desert Hearts Records in 2014, which I've signed records from my friends, musical heroes, and other world-class dance artists from around the globe. Marking the label's upcoming 100th release milestone in April 2021 is my debut album titled, ‘For The Love.’ This album represents all the things I've learned and loved touring the globe these past 8 years.

data.name: DNB Girls Takeover Hosted By Crystal Fresh
The Chillage - Ill.Gates, Mr. Bill, Shmani, Slowform
data.body:
ill.Gates is a name known by nearly all producers in the English speaking world. His songs have been in the iTunes Top Ten Electronic Charts several times. DJs play his music every weekend and fans wear their ill.Gates tattoos with pride. Some of his collaborators include 42 Dugg, Alanis Morisette, Andrew Huang, Apashe, Beats Antique, Captain Hook, CloZee, Conrank, The Dead Kennedys, Destroid, Eprom, EyeOnEyez, G Jones, Gucci Mane, ill-esha, KJ Sawka, Liquid Stanger, Masia One, Mimosa, Minnesota, Mr Bill, Opiuo, RIP Kenny, Stephan Jacobs, Stylust, UHNK, Vaedynn, and Zain Effendi (composer on Pirates of the Caribbean, Dark Knight). His ringtones can be heard on the Windows Phone and the animatronic Droids perform to his music at Star Wars Disneyland. At this point I think it’s safe to say ill.Gates is a household name. When he isn’t composing his own music ill.Gates is teaching the next generation of musicians and providing employment opportunities through Producer Dojo, an organization he founded in 2016 with the goal of ‘launching 1000 music careers’. Producer Dojo uses a martial arts belt system to cultivate discipline in young music producers, provides them an outlet for release on the Dojo record label, and helps them create an online business selling samples, sounds and services. ill.Gates is known for traveling the globe but has recently moved to Los Angeles in order to build a studio for the Producer Dojo, which opened in 2018.

Mr. Bill is an electronic music producer, and DJ from Sydney, Australia (currently residing in the USA) best known for his willingness to share tips in studio techniques & massive library of technical know-how with other aspiring producers. With a huge catalog of released original music (including many collaborations and remixes), Mr. Bill has worked with established artists such as deadmau5, Ganja White Night, Subtronics, Dirt Monkey, Virtual Riot, Infected Mushroom, and more.
Having released music on a wide array of well-known labels such as mau5trap, Monstercat, Subcarbon, Deadbeats, Cyclops, & WAKAAN has led to Bill touring the globe extensively & playing many major music festivals & world-renowned venues such as Red Rocks Amphitheatre, and Hampton Coliseum. Brian Taylor (director of Crank: High Voltage - starring Jason Stathom, and SyFy TV hit “Happy!”) reached out to Bill to score the motion picture, horror-comedy Mom & Dad, featuring Nicolas Cage & Selma Blair. Bill has also been commissioned to compose, and create sound effects for multiple music libraries, applications, and to-be-released games. Being heavily active in the music production community has led Bill to create his own record label, Billegal Beats, which primarily releases left-field downtempo, and glitch music, and Billegal Sounds - a sample pack company. As well as has developed a VST plug-in “SLAP” in collaboration with Yum Audio.
Mr. Bill runs the educational website mrbillstunes.com which houses 1,000+ hours of educational video content teaching the music production software Ableton Live, and he hosts “The Mr. Bill Podcast” which has had speaking guests such as, Duncan Trussell, deadmau5, Steve Duda, Kill The Noise, Feed Me, Peekaboo, edIT, Mick Gordon, Herobust, Richard Devine, Beardyman, The Flashbulb, Haywyre, Daedelus, Subtronics, Virtual Riot, Misha Mansoor, Jordan Rudess, and YouTube sensations Adamy Neely, and Andrew Huang.

shmani is an electronic producer who experiments with the borders between bass, hyperpop, and trap in her music. She is also a vocalist and often adds her own voice and lyrics to her songs. shmani has a full repertoire of original music which spans across trap, future bass, and experimental deep bass styles that are sure to please the electronic and new age pop crowds.

An unexpected soulscape of low-end bass, wonky beats, and slow grooves. Slowform blurs the line between garden and grime, embracing dark sounds that ignite a light inside. Haunting but flowy. Heavy but weightless. Her beautifully simple melodies cascade into moments of clarity found in the midst of chaos. Close your eyes and be here.

data.name: HOOLAANDTHEGANG
data.body: Born within days and a few blocks away from where the Apache break was recorded Hoola was off to a good start at a very young age. When he was gifted Michael Jacksons “Off the Wall” album in 94 it started a serious life long obsession with acquiring every disco funk record ever made in the world. Also that year moved to Van city from Nelson to experience the heyday of the “rave” scene and witness the impact that House music had on a culture that was happening on a fairly large scale. Dickie Doo,T-Bone, Minute Maid, Markem, Doc Martin, Ali, Czech, Little T, Lace, Tripwire, Hebegebe ,Dee Lite, Garth, Jeno, Spun-K (aka Vinyl Richie) and all the other DJ’s who played the legendary Lux Theatre on Hastings were the earliest inspirations and introduction to the underground. Quite soon after tried to teach himself how to make people dance to disco records in 95/96 in Victoria B.C. where djs Koosh, Rennie dubnut foster, tyger dhula, and Wood and the original boomtown records were holding it down. In 97 back in Nelson Hoola , with a crafty business plan made his mom somehow convinced the government and community futures to give him a loan to be a DJ because there was only 1 other in town back then. The next year he packed up and moved out east to Halifax to help throw the first full moon outdoor parties and work at Vitamin Tribe Imports record store with then future wife and super dj Lion-S Also at the same time headlining the first Shambhala with a cassette tape?!? While in Halifax he hooked up with east coast hip hop guru and funk soul digger legend Jorun who taught him the ropes in deep digging and the original funk breaks. There he would learn about the roots of it all and build an empire of old school even Vader would envy. As the decade came to an end Y2K and the end of the world was looming and Hoola, scared to die on the East, ran back to the hills of B.C. just in time to headline Shambhala 1999 and the 1st yr of the Fractal Forest. By 2001 he started doing the scheduling for a very unorganized yet undeniably wicked party and by 2002 took on all the artist bookings with partner Lion-S. Holding a 8 yr residency In Nelson at club Avalon that later turned into the Legendary Fluid would turn out to be home for Shambhala all year round and a place for underground music to exist in Nelson for years to come. This is where and when Vitamin Tribe evolved into The Pride and promoting djs year round came about. Thanks to them RaSoul, Buck, Garth, Metro Area, Doc Martin,Soul of Man, Adam Freeland, Krafty Kuts ,Solomonic Sound,John Howard, Freq Nasty, Mat the Alien, Vinyl Ritchie, Smalltown djs, Bassnectar,Skream, Glitch Mob and basically everyone from A-Skills to Z-trip have experienced the Kootenay Vibe. Around 2003 till the present The Pride took the reigns of the beach stage at Shambhala and called it the Living Room.The rest has become the stuff legends are made of

data.name: The Pride W/ Lion-S & Hoola
data.body:
Lion-S, a.k.a. Sara Spicer, is a prominent figure in the West Coast Underground and Electronic music culture. With over 25 years of experience, she has curated sets and stages, notably The Living Room Stage at the renowned Shambhala Music Festival.

This is where and when Vitamin Tribe evolved into The Pride and promoting djs year round came about. Thanks to them RaSoul, Buck, Garth, Metro Area, Doc Martin,Soul of Man, Adam Freeland, Krafty Kuts ,Solomonic Sound,John Howard, Freq Nasty, Mat the Alien, Vinyl Ritchie, Smalltown djs, Bassnectar,Skream, Glitch Mob and basically everyone from A-Skills to Z-trip have experienced the Kootenay Vibe. Around 2003 till the present The Pride took the reigns of the beach stage at Shambhala and called it the Living Room.The rest has become the stuff legends are made of

performances.body:
Lion-S, a.k.a. Sara Spicer, is a prominent figure in the West Coast Underground and Electronic music culture. With over 25 years of experience, she has curated sets and stages, notably The Living Room Stage at the renowned Shambhala Music Festival.

Born within days and a few blocks away from where the Apache break was recorded Hoola was off to a good start at a very young age. When he was gifted Michael Jacksons “Off the Wall” album in 94 it started a serious life long obsession with acquiring every disco funk record ever made in the world. Also that year moved to Van city from Nelson to experience the heyday of the “rave” scene and witness the impact that House music had on a culture that was happening on a fairly large scale. Dickie Doo,T-Bone, Minute Maid, Markem, Doc Martin, Ali, Czech, Little T, Lace, Tripwire, Hebegebe ,Dee Lite, Garth, Jeno, Spun-K (aka Vinyl Richie) and all the other DJ’s who played the legendary Lux Theatre on Hastings were the earliest inspirations and introduction to the underground. Quite soon after tried to teach himself how to make people dance to disco records in 95/96 in Victoria B.C. where djs Koosh, Rennie dubnut foster, tyger dhula, and Wood and the original boomtown records were holding it down. In 97 back in Nelson Hoola , with a crafty business plan made his mom somehow convinced the government and community futures to give him a loan to be a DJ because there was only 1 other in town back then. The next year he packed up and moved out east to Halifax to help throw the first full moon outdoor parties and work at Vitamin Tribe Imports record store with then future wife and super dj Lion-S Also at the same time headlining the first Shambhala with a cassette tape?!? While in Halifax he hooked up with east coast hip hop guru and funk soul digger legend Jorun who taught him the ropes in deep digging and the original funk breaks. There he would learn about the roots of it all and build an empire of old school even Vader would envy. As the decade came to an end Y2K and the end of the world was looming and Hoola, scared to die on the East, ran back to the hills of B.C. just in time to headline Shambhala 1999 and the 1st yr of the Fractal Forest. By 2001 he started doing the scheduling for a very unorganized yet undeniably wicked party and by 2002 took on all the artist bookings with partner Lion-S. Holding a 8 yr residency In Nelson at club Avalon that later turned into the Legendary Fluid would turn out to be home for Shambhala all year round and a place for underground music to exist in Nelson for years to come. This is where and when Vitamin Tribe evolved into The Pride and promoting djs year round came about. Thanks to them RaSoul, Buck, Garth, Metro Area, Doc Martin,Soul of Man, Adam Freeland, Krafty Kuts ,Solomonic Sound,John Howard, Freq Nasty, Mat the Alien, Vinyl Ritchie, Smalltown djs, Bassnectar,Skream, Glitch Mob and basically everyone from A-Skills to Z-trip have experienced the Kootenay Vibe. Around 2003 till the present The Pride took the reigns of the beach stage at Shambhala and called it the Living Room.The rest has become the stuff legends are made of

data.name: JGirl & Manousos
data.body:
JGirl & Manousos are 20+ year veteran DJs playing mostly House music that people love and sing along to. Originally from Montreal, they moved to BC in in the mid 2000s to soak up the beautiful mountain scenery. While out East, they began DJing in the vinyl record days and today they continue to keep busy performing at many BC grassroots festivals, ski town pubs, and regional club circuit.

Their new and loyal fans can expect fun-filled sets with a touch of sass, Hip Hop, 80s/90s/00s vocals, and big basslines. An occasional dip into House music classics, Tech House, and UK Garage keeps people happy, smiling, reminiscing, and dancing.

Their Okanagan area project Footwerk Events enters into its 15th year. Join them in Kelowna this fall 2024 as they celebrate!

They often share the stage flow arts and dance performers who add excitement and flare with large props, eye catching outfits, and coordinated dancing to the stage.

Since 2015, Jenn’s patron safety program called Safewerk puts consent, comfort, diversity, and safety first at several licensed venues in Kelowna.

Appearances + residencies: Fractal Forest since 2010, Electric Love 4x, Block Rocking Beats, Motion Notion 6x, NestFest at Red Bird, Altitunes 2x at Big White, BassCoast 2013, KAMP, Ponserosa, Festivus, and BreakoutWest.

Clubs + ski towns: Revelry, Distrikt, Sapphire, Gotham, Flashbacks, Level, Bloom & SpiritBar (Nelson), Snowshoe Sams & Sessions (Big White), as well as Red Mountain, Sun Peaks, Golden, and all sorts of renegade outdoor events and unique venues in the BC Interior.

data.name: Fabula
data.body:
A Costa Rican native inspired by the jungle soundscapes. Fábula is a storyteller, producer, DJ and event curator that crafts rich and diverse musical journeys, characterized by an elegant fusion of world sounds and sophisticated, impactful sound design.

His auditory palette artfully blends light and shadows, navigating through a spectrum of genres including Organic Midtempo, Slow Techno, Dark Disco, Organic House, Afro House, and Indie House.

Fábula's distinctive and versatile sound signature has secured him performances at renowned venues, festivals, and clubs around the world.

data.name: Ndidi Cascade & Powys HJ
data.body:
Ndidi Cascade is a Vancouver-born-and-based hip-hop artist who is of Nigerian/Italian/Irish heritage. A songwriter, vocalist, educator, facilitator and curator, Ndidi has showcased her music, from classrooms to stadiums globally, opening for mega-talents such as Wu-Tang Clan & Femi Kuti. Ndidi Cascade facilitates youth empowerment workshops and hip hop education school programs, using hip-hop as a medium for healthy self-expression. She is also a cultural consultant and ambassador for the Ethós Lab youth empowerment organization. Ndidi Cascade is the creator and producer of ORIGINZ, which is an interactive school show exploring roots of hip hop and Afro-centric music and how it connects to BIPOC struggle and joy. She also tours the festival and school circuits both as a solo artist, and with her collaborative bands including Metaphor & Mad Riddim. Ndidi Cascade is a curator for annual festivals such as Black Music Month Vancouver.


Powys HJ is an affirmative lyricist and powerful performer based in Vancouver B.C. Powys’ songs are often humorous, including themes of bravado and self-love, with threads of vulnerability woven into his verses. Powys is known for throwing events and bringing together many artists of varied disciplines. Lately he’s been gaining notoriety touring around B.C., performing interactive hip hop performances in schools alongside with hip hop legend Ndidi Cascade. Powys HJ is a bright light, with a brilliant future ahead!

data.name: DJ Lefy
data.body:
Lefy’s been Dj-ing since his College radio days and back then it was all vinyl. He’s built a strong dance community in and around Invermere, hosting a multitude of amazing events like Bass Camp, Lefy-Fest and some epic nights at Bud's Boogie Parlor. He has gained some valuable experience from playing the Rock Pit for 2 years and The Time of Your Life Dome @ Burning Man.

Lefy likes to Spread Love Vibrations with amped up, bass heavy, really good music.
From house parties to big festivals, Lefy's zest for life, positive energy and well-intentioned dance sets are sure to get your Booty Shakin' on the dance floor!

Lefy been playing the world famous Fractal Forest at Shambhala Music Festival for over a decade.

data.name: Getting High On Your Own Supply
Underdog
data.body: A Calgary native, the Underdog has been shaping the electronic music landscape for 17 years. Not just a music producer, he's also into crafting branded gear and metal artwork such as the @WhipitWoodsThrone. His artistry reflects a deep rooted dedication to the creative process, embodying the true spirit of the 'Underdog'. With a repertoire spanning Breaks to Big Bass and DNB to Chill Euphoric tunes, he knows how to cater to diverse audiences. As the brain behind the successful No Fucks Given mix series, Underdog brings the best of Bass House, Tech House, G House, Brazilian House, Brazilian Bass, Brazilian Bassline and all forms of dirty house beats to thousands of listeners worldwide. Through the music he shares a message of unity and undying passion for music. Our collective love for music will never die and nor will the Underdogs!

data.name: Be Hazzy
data.body:
Be Hazzy has been dipping his toes into the Canadian West coast music scene for around 20 years. Attending his Shambhala, at ripe young age of 16 back in 2003, Be Hazzy found himself hooked on the feel good, positive vibes the underground rave community provided. Under the name, Music People Productions (2007-2012), he and a few close friends, helped pioneer the electronic music scene in his small town of Medicine Hat, AB. In the years to follow, they proudly hosted some of Canada’s best OG Dj’s such as: Home Breakin Records founders Neighbour and Cal Bass, Stickybuds, Mat the Alien, The Funkhunters, Bryx, Deeps, Wakcutt, Neon Steve, Askillz, DiscoFari, DJ Czech, and even Excision and Marten Horger (before 2010 of course).

In 2014, he started collected 45’s and got himself a couple of Tech 12’s and a mixer to keep up with his love for classic rock sing a longs and Funky groovy soul tunes. Add years of mixing extended morning sets and keeping the party going until he was told to shut it down or the generators ran out of gas, and we’re met with the feel-good vibes Be Hazzy’s is known and loved for.

Today, you can find Be Hazzy feeding off the energy of the crowd, and capturing the hearts of the dancefloor with a sound that refuses to stick to any set of genre rules. Always down for a good time and Keepin the BOOM BOOM ROOM Rockin, don’t miss a chance to see what this legend with play next, cause usually he doesn’t know either

data.name: Kinshira
data.body: Evolving performance artistry for over a decade, Kinshira symbolizes 'Poetic Movement,' merging 'kinetic' for motion with 'shira' for poetry. This group of passionate creatives break the boundaries of traditional circus acts by weaving in theatrics, costuming, and immersive experiences.

data.name: Nick Bike
data.body:
Over his 15+ years of DJ’ing, Nick Bike has made a mark with crowds across North America. Over that same period of time, the [Nick Bike Edit/Remix] has become synonymous with many of your favourite DJs’ digital and physical crates around the world, gathering play support from the likes of Questlove, Just Blaze, Gilles Peterson, and D-Nice.

In 2022, Nick was voted unanimously by R.O.A.D. Podcast listeners as “Best Editor & Remixer”. He is also a two-time Vancouver Red Bull Thre3style champ, as well as a dual invitee to Jazzy Jeff’s prestigious Playlist Retreat.

Nick continues to create and DJ each month, all while also operating a lathe-cut vinyl record studio.

data.name: Defied
data.body: DEFIED is the pairing of rapper/songwriter/producer Vs. (Matthew Richer-Miller) and vocalist/producer JJ Watts (Jamie Joong Watts). Their yet undefinable genre is a head-nodding fusion of hip hop rhythms with original bass-driven electronic beats, layering lyrically dense rap verses and r+b vocals. All of DEFIED’s music is original, often made in collaboration with prophet. featuring post-production work from Ayobudd.

data.name: Luxuryus
data.body: Luxuryus began from an intention of love for music and sharing creative ideas between twin brothers Michael and Mark along with Brent. The group has deep ties to the local DJ community and are collectors of the international music scene. Though the framework of Luxuryus is structured by House, they encompass Electronic, Dance, Latin, Afropop, Bass and a variety of worldwide musical influences. They love nothing more than creating a vibe and sharing a musical experience.

data.name: Just-B
data.body:
DJ Just-B’s musical journey began at the age of 5, when he heard the playful sounds of Raffi and Smurf’s Sing-Along coming from his grandpa’s record player. He was instantly “hooked on wax”. B grew up near Toronto, Ontario (Canada), where he grooved his way through a diverse selection of genres and musical styles while learning a little piano and guitar along the way. Years later this would all turn out to be a huge influence on a passionate DJ career.

While exploring the underground house, techno, and jungle scene in the early 90’s, B picked up a used set of “Tech-12” turntables and an old mixer from a local DJ/friend. Thus began a life of track-blending, crate-digging, and endless late-night apartment sessions. Since 1999 B’s been based in Nelson, BC (Canada), where his unique blend of “dirty-sexy-funky-chunky-boompty-bouncy-irresistibly-danceable house music” has evolved into a dancefloor favorite by those in the know. Always, at the heart of his selections, lies his personal love of big bass lines, slick and luscious lyrics, instrumental talent, and smooth-funky-groovy-sexy-and a little bit cheesy-positive vibe-sound…

In addition to gigs in Europe and South & Central America, Just-B has rocked clubs, parties, and festivals throughout his home province of British Columbia. This includes 39 performances over 24 years on 9 different stages at Shambhala Music Festival, where he has become a house fan fav… In addition, his assembly of wine bar mixes, compiled alongside the lovely selectress Lady V, remain atop the playlists, long past their debut. He has DJ’d alongside legends such as: Justin Martin, Mark Farina, Joshua (Iz), JT Donaldson, Hipp-E, Fred Everything, Luke Solomon, Jason Hodges, Kid Koala, Questlove, Freaky Flow, Vinyl Ritchie, and more…

Known to deliver the right beats for the right time, B continues to please audiences with his timely selections and smooth mixing style. Without fail, his vast array of quality tracks wows listeners and keeps the crowds jumpin’ the whole set through. Featuring luscious lyrics, complete solos, booming basslines, phat hooks, and swinging beats, each track he drops features a clear human element. B aspires to inspire positive and happy vibes throughout his performances, and his musical versatility is widely accepted. Though best known for his epic house sets, his downtempo, lounge, hip-hop, nu disco, breakbeats, techno, and drum n’ bass deliveries have also proven surprisingly accessible to some and fully embraceable for most. Whether fast, slow, new, old, hard, soft, or all of the above, DJ Just-B is worth checking out.

I am real.

This is me.

Just-B

data.name: Mr. Wu
data.body: Hailing from Portland, Oregon, Mr. Wu's sound blends a variety of genres and tempos while staying in the pocket. Focused on storytelling through music and cultivating an inspiring dance floor.

performances.body: Hailing from Portland, Oregon, Mr. Wu's sound blends a variety of genres and tempos while staying in the pocket. Focused on storytelling through music and cultivating an inspiring dance floor.

data.name: Murge
data.body: A sonic alchemist, Murge weaves the eclectic and the electric to create dancefloor-centric beats that fill the space and lift the crowd. Unorthodox sounds intertwine to create an expansive aural journey filled with fresh, earthy bass and neoteric instrumentals. No stranger to packed dance floors or epic stages, Murge has entranced crowds at some of North America’s most well respected electronic festivals, including BC’s own Bass Coast and Shambhala. Signed to Emancipator’s label Loci Records, Murge is riding high following a couple of breakout years, winning accolades from peers and listeners alike. Following collaborations with Emancipator and Frameworks, and with support from heavyweights such as BBC Radio 1, BBC Radio 6, Sirius XM, and Indie Shuffle, not to mention landing on some of the biggest Spotify and Apple Music editorial playlists going for electronic music, Murge is confidently carving out his place in the electronic landscape.

data.name: Trevor Galore
data.body:
Trevor Galore - A.K.A. (DJ Twotimer) is a mix of bass heavy drum and bass and melodic bass music. One of the original members of the PK Crew from Calgary Alberta, Trevor has had his hand in most of Western Canada's EDM festival and concert scene over the last 20 years
Trevor started his DJ career in 1998, has been a part of the Village Stage since 2005, and been a part of Shambhala since his first visit as a patron, in 2001.

data.name: Antidote Collective
data.body:
Many moons ago the Antidote event series was conceived by the DJ Duo, Dose. (Taylor & Max). Antidote was created to push the boundaries of societal and industry norms, amplify diversity, provide safer spaces for all humans to enjoy, andto transmit conscious messaging.

Antidote was created to inspire community...to make a space where we all rise up together.

Sonically, the Antidote events have always aimed to provide a platform to showcase an unorthodox niche of sound...or as some call it “80s Vampire Dungeon Disco.”

The event curation also focuses on elevating the way in which people experience dance music culture. Antidote expands beyond the scope of traditional expectations by creating unique visceral-immersive Art Experiences and safer spaces to explore sexual liberation. Full of evocative Performance Art and delightful oddities, here people can truly let their freak flags fly.

Over the years the Antidote event series blossomed into an incredible community of humans. The Antidote Collective became a place where people value the vulnerability of meaningful human connection, on and off the dancefloor.

Antidote also brought together a unique creative Familia, a collection of talented people who live at the intersection between Theatre, Contemporary Art, Kink, Burlesque, Circus, and Underground Music. These are the people that have become the backbone of the event series, working together to dazzle the audience and create unforgettable experiences. This big gay Vampire Familia is proud to bring this subterranean underground to the people of Shambhala at the Livingroom Stage.

You’re invited to join Antidote’s Sonic Healers Dose., Emerencz, and Robert E. Livingood plus Antidote Performance Artists Éowyn, Cody Scheff, Mz. Iris Wilde, Marloe Blu, and Pinku on
a journey through the darkness, into the light, where the veil is thin and the magic potent.

Expect the unexpected and come prepared to be enchanted.

data.name: DJ co.kr
data.body:
Blazing a trail for UK-flavored sounds across clubs in Korea, DJ co.kr and his party brand Ghetto-Ray are on a mission to change the landscape of Seoul dancefloors blending Bass & Perc, UK funky and other worldly forms of dance music with local rap and electronic productions. And he's been inspired by it and tries to apply the Korean sound to the club tune. He released his debut EP [SOUNDBWOY] featured Riko Dan, MC of UK grime group Roll Deep, and Nigerian rising artist Maggugu. He was participated in BOILER ROOM and BBC RADIO, NTS Radio with a Guest Mix.

He has also been a featured DJ for events by the like of Bottega Veneta, Louis Vuitton, Nike, Stüssy and more. His latest EP, [SOUNDBWOY 2] continues the flow that he has been leading with U.K.-based artists such as Lady Lykez, Bryte, Killa P and Riko Dan. Starting with the Boiler Room that he participated again in 2023, he has been reaching out to Europe with his activities and steady releases.

data.name: Danni G
data.body:
Danni G, the Venezuelan transplant now living in Los Angeles, CA, Started his music career in New York City year 2006 at the Dub Spot DJ/Production Academy.

His unique sounds involves anything from original music, remixes of Afro, Amapiano, Gqom, Dancehall, hip hop, Latin and new forward thinking genres. Danni G has played at some the most pristine festivals and venues all across USA and the world captivating the audience with his radiant energy and his music knowledge.

data.name: OnDaMiKe
data.body:
OnDaMiKe is an innovator of the bass music movement that has captured the attention of the world. Fueled by a lifelong love of dance music, the Gainesville, FL native first started DJing in 1992, playing at local clubs and parties. His potent mix of old school bass music and slamming breaks basslines made him a local favorite. As he skyrocketed in popularity he went on to play major events and festivals, Producing banger after banger his energetic bass music to increasingly enthusiastic fans.

OnDaMiKe’s groundbreaking beats have topped iTunes, Beatport, and Juno charts all around the world, establishing him as force to be reckoned with. Be on the look out for new releases that will push the boundaries of the genres and keep dance floors going crazy.

data.name: EL-B
data.body: El-B originally made his name as part of the legendary Groove Chronicles outfit, being the first artist to bring a dark edge to UK Garage with tracks like ‘Stone Cold’ and ‘1999’. Through his own Ghost Records imprint, El-B has sculpted and defined the modern dubstep sound and famously inspired the prodigious talent of Burial, Benga, Skream and countless others.

data.name: Creek St.
data.body:
Set in motion by the unfolding of a collaborative process. Creek Street Collective guides the listener to a space of timeless reconnection. Weaving together their unique influences through ambient leaning soundscapes of experimental compositions, improvisational exploration, trip-hop inspired downtempo beats, electro-acoustic instrumentation and ethereal vocal song.

Featuring Jeff Riel (more like space) on guitar, Chris Rosso on production & live beats, Devon Ecru on vocals and Nella Banner on violin and vocals

data.name: Gabby Haze
data.body: Gabby Haze takes you on an eclectic journey through a low frequency bass maze. Years spent touring the festival scene has shaped her style to become one of vast variety with an international flair. Her sets always boast a beautiful blend of sounds from across the world. Haze acquired her diverse taste in music during her days and nights spent on dancefloors all across the West Coast bass scene. She is becoming a well recognized, up and coming young artist who is connecting the dots far and wide. Ride the hazy vibe that transforms time and space to a vacation beyond the senses.

data.name: DJ Hannah
data.body:
World disco, searing techno and explosive voguing tracks are some of the flavours you can expect from DJ Hannah, a most versatile selector. DJ Hannah's zeal for eclecticism was the product of a Montreal upbringing and an unending curiosity with the hidden gems of music history. Her earliest sets at house parties around Calgary were coloured with the authenticity of an old soul, drawing the attention of the community at large. Following her 2017 club debut she continued generating forward momentum, moving into the role of promoter and show runner with DIY pop-ups and branded club events.

In 2020 Hannah launched the show “Neon Window” on CJSW 90.9 FM examining the history of genres that gave birth to contemporary electronic music like jazz, soul, and funk.
In recent years Hannah has become one of Calgary’s most in-demand DJs, playing shows ranging from underground raves to larger festivals to residencies at weekly club nights across the city. Her ability to captivate audiences across diverse mediums has upended the tech bro monotony and made DJ Hannah synonymous with memorable nights.

data.name: Sintra
data.body:
The Peruvian-American artist known as Sintra, is dance music’s latest talent to step into the
scene and has come across a unique style of his own which can be found at the crossroads of driving bass lines, infectious grooves, lush vocals and crisp, imaginative production. Making waves in the electronic and deep house space, Sintra’s music has been supported by the likes of Keinemusik (&Me, Adam Port, Rampa), Rufus Du Sol and has received play from the likes of Ultra Music, Tomorrowland’s One World Radio, and many more.

data.name: Sistersun
data.body: Some call her Technomama. Others, the Exotic Wife. But most know her as Sistersun. Whether its from her Esfand scented home, behind the altars of Kootenay mountain raves, or venues across her town, this Iranian-Canadian DJ and producer is a music maker by blood. Across genres, Sistersun selects bouncy, sultry, and soulful sounds. She draws her influence from language, culture and the dark side of the sun.

data.name: VHOOR
data.body:
25-year old producer, VHOOR, is one of Brazil’s brightest talents to take the international stage. Hailing from the city of Belo Horizonte, VHOOR has been able to build a loyal fanbase both in Brazil and overseas, mixing global electronic music with Brazilian and Afro-Latino rhythms..

VHOOR’s work with American producer Sango, for their 2019 EP “Acima” helped introduce VHOOR’s talents to a global audience, while the two worked together for Sango’s more recent projects, including his album “Da Rocinha 4” and his EP “Sangozinho.” VHOOR’s music is frequently played on Soulection Radio (Apple Music 1), KCRW (Los Angeles), KEXP (Seattle), BBC1Xtra, BBC Radio6, WWFM, NTS, Bandcamp Weekly and others. His album releases have also been covered by international media outlets including The Guardian, Complex, AfroPUNK, Okayplayer, Bandcamp, DJ Mag, and Rolling Stone.

In Brazil, VHOOR is one of today’s go-to producers, working with some of Brazil’s brightest talents in the Hip Hop, Electronic, and Baile Funk realm. His latest album “BAILE” with Brazilian rapper FBC, helped modernize Miami Bass and Freestyle production and was widely featured on various Best Albums of 2021 lists. The album was applauded by Brazilian media and the single “Se Ta Solteira” went viral on TikTok and Instagram Reels, resulting in over 66 million plays on Spotify, while charting on several national and global charts on Spotify.

VHOOR continues to push the boundaries of electronic music production, importing international genres and incorporating them with Brazilian Baile Funk and other lesser known Brazilian rhythms. His solo instrumental albums (Ritmo, Baile & Vibes, Baile & Sauce, etc), and his work as part of the collective Weird Baile (alongside producers Mu540 and JLZ), have expanded the conversation on the potential of Brazilian and global electronic music. His 2023 set at Boiler Room x Primavera Sound Barcelona continues to expand VHOOR's audience, receiving worldwide media attention, with fans sharing his set across the globe. The YouTube video has amassed 300k plays since its release.

data.name: Shrimpnose
data.body:
In 2013 Shrimpnose (aka Riley Smithson) purchased his first computer with the money he saved from making sandwiches at Jimmy Johns in his hometown of Minneapolis, MN. Within weeks, Riley found himself engrossed in the software, researching new techniques and gear during his college lectures. Growing up with a stutter that he still struggles with today, Riley often struggled expressing himself. Riley quickly discovered the limitless capabilities of expression through electronic music and began to feel it was “the only language [he] could properly express himself through.” Since then, Riley has managed to pioneer a lane of his own through a vibrant 200+ song discography fluttering between the beautiful and jagged edges of modern electronic music.


With a cumulative 50+ million streams across platforms and releases on esteemed labels Bitbird, Blue Note & Astralworks Records, Brainfeeder, Chillhop, Dome of Doom, Friends of Friends, and most recently Nettwerk Music Group, Shrimpnose has been featured in outlets Complex, BBC, Bandcamp, RinseFM, The Current, EDM.com, Lyrical Lemonade, Dublab, and more. In 2023 Spotify invited Shrimpnose to create two Spotify Singles in collaboration with Blueworks at their Los Angeles campus. Following the release, Shrimpnose signed a record deal with Nettwerk, and has since released two singles under the label - ‘Melt’ and ‘Snowed In’ - the latter, a gorgeous, wintertime lofi record created alongside powerhouse producers Allem Iversom and chief.


Collaboration with artists of diverse backgrounds and genres is a pillar of Shrimpnose’s creative workflow. His most recent album “Toward Heaven” released on Nettwerk Music Group in 2024 followed by his next Dance Album. His last singer-songwriter album, ‘As It Seems’ includes appearances from Anomalie, Bobby Raps, Ryan Hemsworth, Blockhead, Blu, Bad Snacks, Swum, Somni, and Joe Nora, some of whom joined Shrimpnose on his first US headline tour following the record release. Previous collaborators include Little Snake, Daedelus, Bleep Bloop, quickly, quickly, maxime, and more.


In addition to his ‘As It Seems’ headline tour in winter 2023, Shrimpnose joined Gold Panda this fall, Anomalie in 2022, Blockhead in 2021, and Friends of Friends labelmates Somni and Joe Nora in 2022 for their national tours. His festival appearances include Infrasound (2017-2023), Shambhala Music Festival (2024), Snowta (2017-2019), Summerset, 515 Alive, and one of the final Low End Theory showcase nights in Los Angeles.

data.name: Hoola
data.body:
Born within days and a few blocks away from where the Apache break was recorded Hoola was off to a good start at a very young age. When he was gifted Michael Jacksons “Off the Wall” album in 94 it started a serious life long obsession with acquiring every disco funk record ever made in the world. Also that year moved to Vancity from Nelson to experience the heyday of the “rave” scene and witness the impact that House music had on a culture that was happening on a fairly large scale. Dickie Doo,T-Bone, Minute Maid, Markem, Doc Martin, Ali, Czech, Little T, Lace, Tripwire, Hebegebe ,Dee Lite, Garth, Jeno, Spun-K (aka Vinyl Richie) and all the other DJ’s who played the legendary Lux Theatre on Hastings were the earliest inspirations and introduction to the underground.

Quite soon after tried to teach himself how to make people dance to disco records in 95/96 in Victoria B.C. where djs Koosh, Rennie dubnut foster, tyger dhula, and Wood and the original boomtown records were holding it down.

In 97 back in Nelson Hoola, with a crafty business plan made his mom somehow convinced the government and community futures to give him a loan to be a DJ because there was only 1 other in town back then. The next year he packed up and moved out east to Halifax to help throw the first full moon outdoor parties and work at Vitamin Tribe Imports record store with then future wife and super DJ Lion-S Also at the same time headlining the first Shambhala with a cassette tape?!? While in Halifax he hooked up with east coast hip hop guru and funk soul digger legend Jorun who taught him the ropes in deep digging and the original funk breaks. There he would learn about the roots of it all and build an empire of old school even Vader would envy. As the decade came to an end Y2K and the end of the world was looming and Hoola, scared to die on the East, ran back to the hills of B.C. just in time to headline Shambhala 1999 and the 1st year of the Fractal Forest. By 2001 he started doing the scheduling for a very unorganized yet undeniably wicked party and by 2002 took on all the artist bookings with partner Lion-S. Holding an 8 year residency in Nelson at club Avalon that later turned into the Legendary Fluid would turn out to be home for Shambhala all year round and a place for underground music to exist in Nelson for years to come. This is where and when Vitamin Tribe evolved into The Pride and promoting DJs year round came about. Thanks to them RaSoul, Buck, Garth, Metro Area, Doc Martin, Soul of Man, Adam Freeland, Krafty Kuts, Solomonic Sound, John Howard, Freq Nasty, Mat the Alien, Vinyl Ritchie, Smalltown DJs, Bassnectar, Skream, Glitch Mob and basically everyone from A-Skills to Z-trip have experienced the Kootenay Vibe.

Around 2003 till the present, The Pride took the reigns of the beach stage at Shambhala and called it the Living Room.The rest has become the stuff legends are made of.

data.name: Adham Shaikh
data.body: An interstellar traveller specializing in global frequencies. Fusing Dance culture with the ancestor's vibrations. Adham's music transcends time and place. A mix of styles and forms from ambient to progressive, glitch hop to trip-hop, klezmer to raga's. a bit of dub n breaks to blend it all together with tribal beats to get the feet moving. Adham has released with many labels + now sonicturtlemusic.com

data.name: Lion-S
data.body:
Lion-S, also known as Sara Spicer, is a prominent figure in the West Coast underground and electronic music scene. With over 25 years of experience, she has curated sets and stages, notably The Living Room Stage at the renowned Shambhala Music Festival. Her contributions to the electronic music community date back to the mid-90s. Her deep connection to music from an early age has significantly influenced and shaped her taste, allowing her to explore a wide range of genres. Lion-S delivers genre-fluid DJ sets meticulously tailored to the time slot and vibe of each venue. Her selections are rich and diverse, complemented by a confident and feminine stage presence.

Sara’s long-lasting commitment to living and breathing her art extends far beyond being on stage as a performer. She is a successful business entrepreneur with a lengthy history of dedication to fostering the dance music scene across Canada. As an event producer and curator, she has a genuine love for supporting international music producers. Behind the decks, she enjoys the reciprocal connection with the crowd on the dance floor, crafting sets in response to the vibe.

As a founding member of Meowmix, an iconic all-female DJ crew based in Nelson, BC, spanning over two decades, Sara Spicer has played a pivotal role in shaping the landscape and empower women to shine in today’s industry. Additionally, she collaborates with her brother Birdriot under the moniker Nür Tür, producing deep bass music and obscurities.

data.name: Chimp It
data.body:
Hybrid Electronic DJ/Live Performance

''Blending the richness of cutting edge electronic music with the depth and emotion of blistering guitar licks and live vocals''

Chimp It’s signature move is to keep their fans guessing, as they weave their original material into edits and remixes from their favourite artists and peers, moving through Garage, Dubstep, House, DnB or whatever fresh gems they’ve uncovered in the far reaches of the music-verse.

data.name: Binks
data.body:
Binks found solace and passion for electronic music at the young age of 8, immersing herself in the captivating sounds of Deadmau5, Above & Beyond, and ATB. As she grew up, attending live events became a cherished pastime, sparking a real interest in DJing and music production.
With over 7 years of dedicated piano practice in her younger years, music became an integral part of Binks' life. She found herself drawn to the art of electronic storytelling, finding inspiration in the works of esteemed artists, such as Sebastien Leger, Sasha, Hernan Cattaneo, and Rodriguez Jr.
Binks' musical inclination leans towards the realms of progressive, deep, melodic, tribal, and afro house, seamlessly blending genres to construct sets that captivate and engage audiences. Her meticulous track selection reflects her commitment to curating experiences that resonate on an emotional level.

Despite initial reservations about taking center stage, Binks felt compelled to share her musical journey with others. Opening for renowned artists like Spencer Brown and Shan Nash marked significant milestones in her emerging career, while participation in underground events across Vancouver helped solidify her presence within the local scene.

Recently, Binks has ventured into the realm of music production, driven by a desire to contribute original tracks to the electronic landscape. With aspirations of fostering a greater appreciation for progressive house within Vancouver's music community, she aims to carve a distinctive niche in the city’s vibrant musical landscape.

As Binks continues to evolve as an artist, her unwavering dedication to music and storytelling serves as a source of inspiration for both fellow electronic enthusiasts and aspiring DJs alike.

data.name: Melo.Nade
data.body:
Navin ‘Melo.Nade’ Huq was born and raised in Calgary, Canada. Growing up with hip-hop culturists, he learned the art of digging at an early age, which resulted in an insatiable addiction for finding those hard to find gems. As a child, he would spend time recording mix tapes (yes, cassettes) off the radio, TV, and his dad’s records; satisfying his instinctive nature to sequence tracks as well as delve into music technology. Navin acquired his first set of turntables in 2003, and that’s when Melo.Nade was born. Originally on the hip-hop tip, he experimented with mash ups and tempo changes before the age of Serato and digital DJ’ing. Countless hours were spent in the progression of turntablism and fusing the worlds of trip hop, hip-hop, funk and breaks, into an eclectic vibe.

More recently, the Melo.Nade sound has evolved to embody the term Heavy Chill - downbeat, yet heavy hitting (from deep dubstep to lustful world beats to breaks, hip-hop, and R&B). His endeavours in music production are sculpting a fresh sound that fuses classical and worldly instruments with electronic bass music. The basis of the vibe is flowing and non-repetitive.

In every set, he strives to take you on a walk through music; not just with his tight mixing, but also by seamlessly incorporating edits and layers of purposeful cuts/effects and lush melodies. Melo.Nade’s imaginative and intelligent persona is expressed through his music by delivering bass-driven grooves while maintaining the melodious merit that’s often lost in electronic translation. His diverse experience gives him the edge to read crowds and adapt. No set is the same as he stays true to the musical art form of DJ’ing.

data.name: AMP Live
data.body: Amp Live has fuses the sounds of boom bap hip hop, bass music, melodic soul,  and reggae with a technical and classical sensibility. His hybrid production style not only transcends in the studio, but also onto the live stage. Amp has captivated audiences around the world combining a modern dj set with his "frankenstein like" beat machines. Amp Live has collaborated with some heavy hitting artists such as Liquid Stranger, Dirt Monkey, Mad Zach, and Subdocta. For his releases, he has also partnered with various labels, such as Ganja White Night’s Subcarbon Records, 19k Records, and Gravitas Music Recordings. Outside of Amp's own solo projects, he has also produced for Saweetie, 21 Savage, Rebelution, H.E.R., E40, Too Short, Collie Buddz, and Atmosphere, as well as an official Radiohead remix album. Amp also co-founded the hip hop duo Zion I, Unified Highway with Rebelution’s lead singer Eric Rachmany, and the Del the Funky Homosapien & Amp Live project. Amp Live is soft-spoken and polite in his demeanour, but his sounds are loud, daring, and continuously prove to be ahead of the curve.

data.name: The Gaff
data.body: The Gaff is a lifelong DJ with tight skills & cuts, a lengthy list of accomplishments, tonnes of dope records, heart & class. One foot in the future, and one foot in the past. The Gaff's purpose is to elevate Hip Hop, Dance, Club, and Electronic Sounds to a level easily combined with Funk, Soul & Jazz. The result is amazing live performances & instrumental productions, giving a story of music that ebbs and flows. The Gaff has rocked parties and clubs worldwide: either by all vinyl 45 sets, or destroying it with tight scratching, live drumming on the sampler, and turntable kung fu. A teacher of the essentials, peers and fans alike are often caught overlooking The Gaff's shoulder to see just what it is he’s up to.

data.name: Bodysync
data.body:
Bodysync is the new collaboration between electronic producers Ryan Hemsworth & Giraffage, exploring bright, carefree dance music in all varieties, steeped in referential nods to the classics but firmly focused on pushing forward the sounds of today.

Over the last 10 years, the two producers have released acclaimed albums and EPs with labels such as Fool’s Gold, Last Gang and Counter Records, as well as self-releasing independently. They’ve worked with the likes of Joji, Mitski, E-40, Doss, alongside official remixes for Carly Rae Jepsen, Porter Robinson, ODESZA and Lana Del Ray. The duo have amassed over 200M streams across all platforms combined, and have toured North America together, as well as individually touring Europe, Asia and Australia.

data.name: Jasper Tygner
data.body:
Hailing from North London, Jasper Tygner is a producer, composer and multi-instrumentalist. Jasper creates kaleidoscopic arrangements of rave-inspired, melody-driven tracks bursting with melancholic detail.
 
Shaped by early raving experiences growing up in London’s electronic underground scene, Jasper cites legendary institution Plastic People, along with a deep reverence for Jungle, dubstep and garage as key formative influences. "Ever since I was small I have always loved Garage, I was only listening to the B side of Gorillaz 'Clint Eastwood - the Ed Case Remix.
 
Jasper’s self-released debut EP received strong radio from support on BBC Radio 1, 1Xtra, BBC Introducing and Reprezent Radio, being championed by Jaguar and Jamz Supernova.
 
With his first signed release debuting on leftfield electronic label Needwant in May 2021 and a bank of new material under his belt ready to share with his ever-growing fanbase, Jasper Tygner is firmly placed as one of this year’s most promising ones to watch.

data.name: Mr. Jennings
data.body:
Mr Jennings
[mis-ter jen-ingz]
A sophisticated technique for the delivery of squidges, squooshes, bleeps, blops, and other peculiar sounds. Best administered through a wall of subwoofers at an assembly of gyrating humanoid creatures.

Sounds like: “a psychedelic after-school Satan Club for Furiosas and Lost Boys"
See also: “going to a fancy southern banquet to drink malt liquor out of plastic gasoline jugs"

data.name: Tone Ranger
data.body:
Tone Ranger's music embodies the beauty of the desert - its sands, suns, stars, and oases. Combining classic Americana instrumentation with house and ambient elements, he presents an expansive sound, reaching ecstatic peaks and deep sonic valleys.

Based in Santa Fe, Tone Ranger is one of the most in-demand live electronic acts emerging from the Southwest. He can be found in strange art installations, on major stages, performing out in the desert or at experimental drive-in theaters.

data.name: Synkro
data.body: Manchester’s Joe McBride pens elaborate, emotive & intellectual soundscapes, drawing in influences across a spectrum of bass culture and electronica. Having released with Exit Records, Brownswood, Styrax, Auxiliary & Med School, as well as remixes for Model 500, Snow Patrol, Lowb & a plethora more, Synkro has most recently found a home at R&S sister label ‘Apollo’. Major support for Synkro’s music has come from names like Chris Coco, Giles Peterson, Mary Anne Hobbs, Prefuse 73 and dBridge. A truly staple artist in the timeline of UK Bass.

data.name: Astro Herbalism - House of Origins
data.body:
Join medical herbalist and hermetic practitioner Lux for a journey through the cosmos and the terrestrial treasures. Astroherbalism is a practice that is thousands of years old, joining the arts of astrology and herbalism. Using the concept of “as above, so below” we see how the cosmological patterns mirror the patterns in nature. Learn about the planets, zodiac signs and their corresponding plants. We will also touch on how to use this practice for your own astrology chart to balance your mind / body / spirit.

Lux (they/them) is a medically trained herbalist, medicine maker, ritualist and hermetic practitioner. Their passion for plants and nature has been present since childhood; ultimately leading them to study medicine, entheogens, and ceremonial arts. Over the last decade Lux has immersed themselves in mystery school studies and created a bridge between the scientific and spiritual practices. Lux specializes in menstrual care, womb healing, mental health and digestive disorders. You can also find them hosting classes and ceremonies in the community, it is one of their greatest joys to come together in healing and celebration. In their down time you can find them enjoying nature, hot springs and finding more ways to create beauty in the world.

data.name: Footprints
data.body: Rising from the western Canada music scene, Footprints has made a name for himself both in clubs and festivals around the world through his dedication to event production. Travelling the world with different projects has brought great opportunity to his evolution in the industry. His music sets have diverse variety depending on the crowd in front of him, ranging from house and breakbeat, to Hiphop and sound-system bass music. Over the past 22 years, Footprints has developed a style that is consistent and admired, crafting the perfect union between darkness and beauty.

data.name: Joseph Martin
data.body:
Joseph Martin has been mixing records since 1998, and is a resident DJ at Shambhala Music Festival’s Fractal Forest, since 2004.

From 2003-2006, he hosted The Shakedown, a weekly online radio show, featuring over 80 djs from across Canada, and with the Liquidbeat collective, produced some of the B.C. interior’s most inspiring parties. In 2010, he became a resident dj with Signal Saturdays at the former Lotus Sound Lounge in Vancouver. That same year, he created East Van Digital, and has since curated a catalog of 100 releases, featuring artists from around the world, showcasing a variety of electronic sub-genres.

performances.body:
Joseph Martin has been mixing records since 1998, and is a resident DJ at Shambhala Music Festival’s Fractal Forest, since 2004.

From 2003-2006, he hosted The Shakedown, a weekly online radio show, featuring over 80 djs from across Canada, and with the Liquidbeat collective, produced some of the B.C. interior’s most inspiring parties. In 2010, he became a resident dj with Signal Saturdays at the former Lotus Sound Lounge in Vancouver. That same year, he created East Van Digital, and has since curated a catalog of 100 releases, featuring artists from around the world, showcasing a variety of electronic sub-genres.

data.name: Leland River
data.body:
A north west coast fixture - Leland River is a DJ/Producer whose growth as an artist and human being is deeply tied to the mycelial webs of the BC festival scene.  

Trusted by many of his peers and listeners for his diverse array of productions, mixes, and adept sense for playing the right music at the right time; Leland River has been given the controls at Bass Coast, Envision, and Shambhala for 10 years in a row.
  
From a love of hypnotizing rhythms and the low-end of dubstep, garage, grime, breaks, dancehall, jungle and techno; mixed with a disposition for emotive ambience and a love for R&B - Leland River’s music and DJ sets fit better inside a vast large venn diagram than a box.
